questions.question: Businesses that collect and harness the power of data have what responsibility?
options: To sell the data to the highest bidder
To protect this data from misuse and unauthorized access
To use the data for marketing purposes only
To make the data publicly available
questions.answer: To protect this data from misuse and unauthorized access

questions.question: Which type of hacker breaks into networks or computer systems to discover weaknesses in order to improve security?
An unethical criminal who violates computer and network security for personal gain or malicious reasons is a:
What is a 'Script Kiddie'?
options: A teenager or hobbyist with little or no skill, using existing tools to launch attacks
A highly-skilled cyber criminal working for a large organization
A state-sponsored hacker who gathers intelligence
A grey hat hacker who reports exploits for rewards
questions.answer: A teenager or hobbyist with little or no skill, using existing tools to launch attacks

questions.question: Grey hat hackers who rally and protest against political or social ideas, often by leaking information or using DDoS attacks, are called:
What is the purpose of the Nation Common Vulnerabilities and Exposures (CVE) database?
options: To provide a publicly available database of all known vulnerabilities
To display a real-time visualization of attacks
To share intelligence between the FBI and the private sector
To provide a framework for implementing cybersecurity measures
questions.answer: To provide a publicly available database of all known vulnerabilities

questions.question: Which partnership between the FBI and the private sector is dedicated to sharing information and intelligence to prevent hostile cyberattacks?
Which set of standards provides a framework for implementing cybersecurity measures within an organization?
What is a 'cyber vulnerability'?
options: The possibility that a harmful event will occur
A weakness that makes a target susceptible to an attack
A tool used to capture data streams over a network
An attack that interferes with established network communication
questions.answer: A weakness that makes a target susceptible to an attack

questions.question: A tool that works by monitoring and recording all information coming across a network is called a:
Which attack interferes with an established network communication by constructing packets to appear as if they are part of that communication?
At which level is it an employee's responsibility to protect the organizationâ€™s reputation, data, and customers?
Why do internal threats have the potential to cause greater damage than external threats?
options: Internal users have direct access to the building and its infrastructure devices
Internal threats always come from amateurs or script kiddies
Internal threats can only be stopped by the NSA
Internal users do not have knowledge of the corporate network
questions.answer: Internal users have direct access to the building and its infrastructure devices

questions.question: What is the growing trend of allowing employees to use their personal mobile devices on the corporate network called?
Which of the following is NOT one of the three dimensions of Big Data?
A continuous computer hack that occurs under the radar against a specific object for business or political motives is known as:
What is a telephone denial of service (TDoS) attack?
options: An attack that uses a high volume of phone calls to tie up a target network
An attack that steals confidential data from a phone
An attack that uses phone calls to trick a user into giving up passwords
An attack that monitors phone calls to gather intelligence
questions.answer: An attack that uses a high volume of phone calls to tie up a target network

questions.question: In the NIST Workforce Framework, which category includes providing the support, administration, and maintenance for IT systems?
In the NIST Workforce Framework, which category includes the 'identification, analysis, and mitigation of threats to internal systems and networks'?
In the NIST Workforce Framework, which category includes 'conceptualizing, designing, and building secure IT systems'?
Which entry-level certification certifies the competency of IT administrators in information assurance?
Which EC-Council certification is intermediate-level and asserts that a specialist possesses skills for various hacking practices?
Which high-level, vendor-neutral certification is aimed at specialists with significant technical and managerial experience and is approved by the U.S. DoD?
Which ISACA certification is for specialists responsible for managing, developing, and overseeing information security systems at the enterprise level?
Which Cisco certification validates that a specialist has the knowledge and skills required to secure Cisco networks?
